intro: Alysicarpus vaginalis var. taiwanianus, commonly known as the Taiwan sida, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, including Taiwan. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Alysicarpus. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in partial shade.
